description: Application for a new Mayor's Permit to conduct business within the municipality.
steps: Prepare all required documents.
Submit application form and requirements at the BPLO one-stop shop or online.
Wait for assessment of taxes and fees.
Pay the assessed fees at the Treasurer's Office.
Claim your Business Permit and plates.
requirements: Contract of Lease (if lessee) or Tax Declaration (if owner)

description: Annual renewal of Mayor's Permit for existing businesses.
steps: Present previous year's permit and official receipt.
Submit renewal application form.
Pay regulatory fees and business taxes.
Receive renewed Business Permit.

description: Issuance of Community Tax Certificate for individuals and corporations.
steps: Fill out the CTC application slip.
Present valid ID.
Pay the corresponding tax fee.
Sign and claim the Cedula.

description: Payment of taxes on land, buildings, and machinery (Amilyar).
steps: Present latest Official Receipt or Tax Declaration.
Get assessment from the Assessor's window.
Proceed to Treasurer's window for payment.
Receive Official Receipt.

sources.name: Bureau of Local Government Finance Guidelines

description: Timely registration of birth for newborn children.
steps: Secure Certificate of Live Birth (COLB) from hospital/clinic.
Submit COLB to Civil Registrar.
Review drafted certificate.
Sign and receive registered copy.

description: Permit required before constructing, altering, or repairing any building.
steps: Submit technical documents for evaluation.
Wait for order of payment.
Pay building permit fees.
Claim Building Permit.

sources.name: P.D. 1096 (National Building Code of the Philippines)

description: Annual renewal of franchise for tricycle operators.
steps: Submit unit for roadworthiness inspection.
Present insurance and registration papers.
Pay franchise fee.
Get sticker and permit.

description: A comprehensive list of public elementary and secondary schools in the municipality.
steps: Los Baños Central Elementary School (Timugan)
Mayondon Elementary School
Bayog Elementary School
Lalakay Elementary School
Los Baños National High School (Poblacion)
Bernardo F. San Juan National High School
South Hill School (Private)
University of the Philippines Rural High School

faqs.question: When does enrollment start?
faqs.answer: Enrollment typically begins in July. Please follow the official DepEd page for announcements.

description: Financial assistance program for deserving college students.
steps: Submit application form with grades.
Undergo interview/screening.
Wait for posting of qualified scholars.
Attend orientation and contract signing.

description: Weekly schedule for waste collection per barangay. Please segregate biodegradable and non-biodegradable waste.
steps: Monday & Thursday: Batong Malake, San Antonio, Maahas (Biodegradable)
Tuesday & Friday: Bayog, Mayondon, Malinta (Biodegradable)
Wednesday: All Barangays (Non-Biodegradable / Recyclables)
Saturday: Special collection for Market area
Sunday: No Collection
requirements: Please ensure waste is segregated before putting it out.
Bring out trash only between 6:00 AM - 8:00 AM.

sources.name: Republic Act No. 9003 (Ecological Solid Waste Management Act)

description: Locations of health centers providing free primary care, immunization, and maternal services.
steps: RHU 1: Main Health Center, Municipal Hall Compound, Brgy. Timugan
RHU 2: Brgy. Batong Malake (Near Barangay Hall)
RHU 3: Brgy. Mayondon (Purok 3)
Animal Bite Center: Municipal Hall Compound

description: Required for food handlers and employees in business establishments.
steps: Submit chest x-ray and stool exam results.
Attend food handler's seminar (if applicable).
Pay health fee.
Claim Health Certificate.

sources.name: P.D. 856 (Code on Sanitation of the Philippines)

description: Assistance to Individuals in Crisis Situations for medical needs.
steps: Submit requirements for screening.
Undergo interview by Social Worker.
Receive Guarantee Letter or Cash Assistance.

sources.name: DSWD Memorandum Circular No. 02 Series of 2014

description: Issuance of ID and purchase booklet for senior citizens (60 years old and above).
steps: Fill out application form.
Submit requirements.
ID processing and printing.
Claim ID and booklets.

sources.name: Republic Act No. 9994 (Expanded Senior Citizens Act)

description: Availability of free vegetable seeds and subsidized fertilizers for local farmers.
steps: Available Seeds: Eggplant, Tomato, Pechay, Mustard, Sitaw
Location: Municipal Agriculture Office, Hall Compound
Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM
requirements: Must be a registered farmer (RSBSA) for fertilizer subsidies.

description: Process for illegitimate children to be considered legitimate through the subsequent marriage of their parents.
steps: Gather all required documents.
Submit requirements to the Local Civil Registry Office.
Pay the processing fee.
Wait for the processing of the Affidavit of Legitimation.
requirements: Certificate of No Marriage of both Parents (CENOMAR)
Certificate of Live Birth of the Child (PSA Copy) - 6 copies
Affidavit of Legitimation (executed by both parents)

description: Registration of a birth that was not reported within thirty (30) days after its occurrence.
steps: Secure Negative Certification of Birth from PSA.
Accomplish four (4) copies of the Certificate of Live Birth (COLB).
Prepare at least two supporting documents (Baptismal, School Records, etc.).
Submit documents and pay the processing fee.
requirements: Negative Certification of Birth from PSA
Affidavit to Use the Surname of the Father (if applicable)
At least two: Baptismal Cert, Form 137, Medical Record, ITR, or Voter's Affidavit

sources.name: Revised Rules and Regulations Governing the Registration of Civil Registry Documents

service: Petition for Correction of Month/Date of Birth (R.A. 10172)
description: Administrative remedy for correcting clerical or typographical errors in the day and/or month of birth in the Civil Register.
requirements: Document to be corrected (OCRG and LCRO Copy)
Affidavit of Publication and Newspaper Clippings

description: Administrative procedure to correct an erroneous entry in the sex of a person in the Certificate of Live Birth.
requirements: Document to be corrected (OCRG and LCRO Copy)
Medical Certification from Government Physician (No Sex Change undergone)
Certificate of Authenticity of Medical Certification
Affidavit of Publication and Newspaper Clippings

description: Legal requirement for two people intending to get married within the Philippines.

sources.name: Title I, Chapter 2 of the Family Code of the Philippines

description: Financial assistance provided semi-annually to qualified solo parents in the municipality.
steps: Register as a Solo Parent with the MSWDO.
Submit required documents during the designated payout period.
Receive cash subsidy (Php 1,000 per month or as allocated).

sources.name: Republic Act No. 11861 (Expanded Solo Parents Welfare Act of 2022)

description: Financial grant for students from Junior High School to College levels to assist with educational expenses.
steps: Submit application form with academic grades to LYDO.
Wait for verification and posting of qualified grantees.
Attend the scheduled payout ceremony.
requirements: Recent Report Card / Transcript of Records

description: Required for new kWhr meter applications, reconnections, or relocations to ensure electrical safety compliance.
steps: Secure and fill up the Certificate of Final Electrical Inspection form.
Gather requirements based on application type (Old/New building or Reconnection).
Submit documents at the Municipal Engineering Office.
Undergo site inspection by the Engineering Office.
Claim certificate after approval.
requirements: Properly filled-up Certificate of Final Electrical Inspection form (Signed by EE or Master Electrician)
Photocopy of Proof of Property (TCT, Tax Declaration, MUDHO, or Business Permit)

description: Certifies that a newly constructed or renovated structure is safe for use and complies with the National Building Code.
requirements: Construction Logbook (Signed/sealed by Owner's Architect or Civil Engineer)
As-Built Plans (Signed/sealed by Architect or Civil Engineer)
Photocopy of valid PRC licenses of all involved professionals
Captioned photographs of front, sides, rear, and septic tank
Yellow Card from Electrical Service Provider

sources.name: Unified Application Form for Certificate of Occupancy

description: Required for occupancy and business permits to ensure the structure meets fire safety standards.
requirements: Building Permit Number and Date Issued

description: The primary legal authorization required before starting construction, alteration, or repair of any building.
requirements: 5 copies of filled-up Notarized Unified Application Form for Building Permit
3 photocopies of Valid PRC Licenses of involved professionals
Notarized estimated value of building structure
4 sets of Drawing Plans (Signed/sealed by Engineers)
3 sets of Lot Plan (Signed/sealed by Geodetic Engineer)
Proof of Ownership (OCT/TCT/Deed of Absolute Sale)

description: A technical sub-permit required for the installation of electronic systems within a building structure.
requirements: 4 copies of filled-up Application Form for Electronics Permit
Valid PRC Licenses of involved Electronics Engineers

description: Permit for the installation of outdoor signs, billboards, or business identifiers.
requirements: 4 copies of Properly filled-up Sign Permit Form
Drawing Plans (4 sets) and General Specifications
Notarized estimated value of the structure

description: Required before the total or partial destruction of any building or structure.
requirements: 4 copies of filled-up Demolition Permit Form
Drawing Plans (2 sets) and Lot Plan (1 set)

description: Permit for the construction of perimeter fences or walls.
requirements: 4 copies of filled-up Fencing Permit Form
Drawing Plans (4 sets) and Lot Plan (3 sets)
Construction Safety and Health Program (CSHP - DOLE)

description: General medical consultations and minor surgical procedures provided by the Municipal Health Office.
steps: Registration and triage at the RHU entrance.
Initial assessment of vital signs by nursing staff.
Consultation with a medical officer.
Laboratory testing if required.
Issuance of prescriptions or referral for surgical procedures.

quickInfo.whoCanApply: Residents in need of medical attention

sources.name: Municipal Health Office Manual of Operations

description: Oral health services including tooth extraction, cleaning, and consultations.
Diagnostic laboratory tests including blood chemistry, urinalysis, and fecalysis.
Environmental health services and inspection of establishments for sanitary compliance.
Immunization, nutrition monitoring, and pediatric consultations for infants and children.
Prenatal and postnatal care for expectant and new mothers.
24/7 facility-based delivery services for low-risk pregnancies.
Consultation and provision of various family planning methods.
Comprehensive care related to reproductive wellness and STI prevention.
Anti-rabies vaccination and wound management for individuals bitten by animals.
Sputum examination and DOTS (Directly Observed Treatment Short-course) for Tuberculosis.

service: Programmatic Management of Drug Resistant Tuberculosis (PMDT)
description: Specialized care and medication management for drug-resistant TB strains.
Psychological support, counseling, and referral services for mental wellness.
Surveillance and mitigation strategies for communicable diseases within the municipality.
Blood donation drives and assistance in sourcing blood for patients in need.
Health education and clinical services specifically tailored for teens and young adults.
Mobile medical clinics conducted in various barangays for far-flung communities.
Issuance of medical certificates, health cards, and sanitary permits.
steps: Present required medical exam results (X-ray, etc.)
Payment of fees at the window.
Review by health officer.
Issuance of signed certificate.

description: Provision of cash incentives for elderly residents reaching milestone ages of 80, 85, 90, and 95, facilitated by the National Commission of Senior Citizens (NCSC).
steps: Verify if the senior's name is included in the official NCSC Masterlist (January to June 2025 batch).
Secure required templates (Authorization, SPA, or Warranty & Release forms) from the OSCA Office between 8:00 AM and 5:00 PM.
Prepare the specific set of documents based on the claimant's status (Personal, Representative, or Deceased).
Proceed to the Municipal Treasury Office on the designated payout date and time.
Submit documents for verification and receive the cash incentive.
requirements: FOR PERSONAL CLAIM: 2 copies of valid ID with signature or thumbmark.
FOR REPRESENTATIVE: Authorization Letter (NCSC template), Physical ID of grantee (original + photocopy), Physical ID of claimant (original + photocopy).
FOR REPRESENTATIVE (BEDRIDDEN): Barangay Certification signed by Captain and BHW or Medical Certificate.
FOR REPRESENTATIVE (PROOF OF LIFE): Half-body photo of the grantee holding a current calendar or newspaper.

FOR DECEASED GRANTEE: Special Power of Attorney (SPA template), Warranty and Release from Liability form, Original or CTC of Death Certificate, Claimant ID with 3 signatures, and Proof of Relationship.

faqs.question: Where can I get the SPA or Authorization templates?
faqs.answer: Templates are available at the Office of the Senior Citizens Affairs (OSCA) from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this specific payout?
faqs.answer: Seniors who are part of the qualified beneficiaries list from January to June 2025 provided by the NCSC.

quickInfo.documents: Valid IDs, SPA/Authorization, Proof of Life

sources.name: Office of the Senior Citizens Affairs (OSCA) Los Baños
